site_name: CHARLES Mc GINNIS & DEBBI Mc GINNIS

citations.narrative:
During the inspection several enclosures in the sheltered building, housing ten adults and five puppies were excessively
dirty. On the outside portion two enclosures had accumulated feces covering approximately 75% of the floor space. After
announcing themselves and putting on booties inspectors noticed the licensee scraping out feces from these pens. On
the inside portion there were numerous cobwebs and grime on the wires of the enclosures and feed containers. Also, in at
least one pen it was noticed to be visibly damp and a layer of brown grime appearing to consist of hair, mud and feces
covering the flooring. Feces, dirt, and grime can harbor organisms that can affect the health and well being of the dogs.
Hard surfaces with which the dogs come in contact must be spot cleaned daily and sanitized in accordance with §3.11(b)
of this subpart to prevent accumulation of excreta and reduce disease hazards. The licensee must ensure that cleaning
and sanitization are done as frequently as necessary to maintain cleanliness.
To be correct by: July 22, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Lindsay Livingston, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.1(c)(3)  Repeat
   
Housing facilities, general. 
During the inspection several enclosures in the sheltered building, housing ten adults and five puppies were excessively 
dirty. On the outside portion two enclosures had accumulated feces covering approximately 75% of the floor space. After 
announcing themselves and putting on booties inspectors noticed the licensee scraping out feces from these pens. On 
the inside portion there were numerous cobwebs and grime on the wires of the enclosures and feed containers. Also, in at 
least one pen it was noticed to be visibly damp and a layer of brown grime appearing to consist of hair, mud and feces 
covering the flooring. Feces, dirt, and grime can harbor organisms that can affect the health and well being of the dogs. 
Hard surfaces with which the dogs come in contact must be spot cleaned daily and sanitized in accordance with §3.11(b) 
of this subpart to prevent accumulation of excreta and reduce disease hazards. The licensee must ensure that cleaning 
and sanitization are done as frequently as necessary to maintain cleanliness.  
To be correct by: July 22, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

Lindsay Livingston, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
